answers.author: Thomas Wieczorek
answers.text:
A very good group with which to become active with is called "Vision 20/20." Organized through the Institution of Fire Engineers (IFE), Vision 20/20 has worked to bring the concepts of Community Risk Reduction to th United States.  The concepts were developed in the UK and Australia and replaced traditional methodologies to risk reduction and deployment of resources beginning in 2000 following a white paper that examined Standards of Response Coverage and the outcome it produced (SOC is the method by which most US fire departments deploy and on which "standards" such as NFPA 1710 are modeled). 
The Vision 20/20 website is: http://www.strategicfire.org/main.cfm?pageID=25. I have represented ICMA with the Vision 20/20 group for a number of years and we are working to conduct a webinar for managers stressing the importance of embracing the process. We have worked with the retired chief of Merseyside Fire District, Tony McGuirk, on a number of programs and hope to announce one geared for managers and their fire chiefs soon!
The Vision 20/20 site will point you in the direction of a number of agencies that have employed the process.

author: Howard Lagomarsino
text: We are in the process of reorganizing our prevention stratgies. Traditionally programs have focused on fire prevention, but we are looking to adopt a more holistic approach. Some initial ideas include accident prevention and elderly fall prevention. We are looking for examples of programs that may be in place already and any help with ideas/topics would be appreciated as we try to advance this initiative.
title: Community Risk Reduction
